description:
BuildZoom is a better way to remodel. We connect homeowners to the most reliable general contractors in their area and make remodeling simpler, cheaper and more predictable.  

Our technology harvests public data on every licensed contractor in the United States, including license information, building permits, bond and insurance information and other government records. We use this public data along with private data gleaned from past BuildZoom marketplace interactions to evaluate contractor quality, availability, and fit for each construction project. Our goal is to help project owners arrive at several competitive bids from highly qualified and experienced construction companies to ensure a fair price and a successful project.

We build tools to help contractors look their best online, manage their lead pipeline, seamlessly interact with project owners, and compose professional bid proposals.
generated_description:
**BuildZoom: A Smarter Way to Remodel**

Founded in 2013 and part of Y Combinator's W13 batch, BuildZoom is revolutionizing the way homeowners approach remodeling projects. Located in the heart of San Francisco, the company has swiftly grown a dedicated team of around 100 employees, all focused on one mission: making remodeling simpler, cheaper, and more predictable.

So, how does BuildZoom accomplish this? The company leverages cutting-edge technology to sift through public data on every licensed contractor across the United States. This includes everything from license and insurance information to building permits and past project records. By combining this public data with insights gained from previous interactions in their marketplace, BuildZoom can effectively evaluate contractor quality, availability, and the best fit for specific construction projects. 

The process aims to connect homeowners with reliable general contractors in their local areas, ensuring they receive several competitive bids from experienced professionals. This not only helps in getting fair prices but also increases the odds of a successful remodeling project.

But BuildZoom doesn’t stop there. They also equip contractors with essential tools to bolster their online presence, manage leads, interact seamlessly with clients, and create professional bid proposals. This commitment to supporting contractors enhances the overall quality of the service they provide to homeowners.

In essence, BuildZoom is more than just a platform; it's a comprehensive resource for both homeowners and contractors. By leveraging data and technology, they are paving a better path for remodeling—one that prioritizes transparency and efficiency.

For more details, you can check out their website: [BuildZoom](https://www.buildzoom.com).
headline: BuildZoom is a better way to remodel. We connect homeowners to theâ¦
name: BuildZoom

description: CircuitLab makes it easier for electrical engineers, students, and electronics hobbyists to design, analyze, build, and share electronic circuits.
generated_description:
**CircuitLab: Your Go-To Online Circuit Simulator**

Founded in 2012 as part of Y Combinator’s W13 batch, CircuitLab has carved a niche in the online electronics design space. Located in Redwood City, CA, this nimble operation consists of just two dedicated team members, making it a quintessential startup—lean, focused, and innovative.

### What They Do

CircuitLab provides a powerful online platform for designing, analyzing, and sharing electronic circuits. It caters to electrical engineers, students, and electronics enthusiasts alike, enabling them to create schematics and run simulations right from their web browsers, no installation required. Here's a quick rundown of their features:

- **Intuitive Schematic Editor**: Users can easily design circuits with a user-friendly interface.
- **Circuit Simulation**: Both analog and digital circuits can be simulated in real time, presenting results in seconds.
- **Professional Outputs**: The platform generates high-quality schematic PDFs, wiring diagrams, and plots suitable for documentation and presentations.
- **Interactive Learning Resources**: CircuitLab offers an interactive electronics textbook, titled **Ultimate Electronics**, helping users grasp complex topics in a straightforward manner.

They also foster a community-oriented approach with a dedicated forum for **Electronics Q&A**, where users can ask questions and share knowledge.

### Unique Features

What sets CircuitLab apart from conventional circuit simulation tools is its emphasis on **accessibility** and **sharing**. Users can easily:
- Connect elements in their designs with fewer clicks thanks to their **Easy-wire mode**.
- Share their work through unique circuit URLs, making collaboration seamless.
- Access a diverse array of components, including SPICE-like models for accurate simulations of nonlinear effects.

These features contribute to an engaging environment that accelerates learning and design iteration, ensuring that users can validate their ideas without having to instinctively reach for a soldering iron.

### Impact and Recognition

Since its inception, CircuitLab has garnered praise for its intuitive design and extensive features. Publications like **EDN** and **Hackaday** have highlighted its user-friendliness and robust capabilities, earning a reputation as a solid tool for both novices and experienced engineers alike.

### Conclusion

In short, CircuitLab is not just a tool; it's a complete ecosystem for electronic design that emphasizes ease of use, community interaction, and innovation. For anyone looking to dive into the world of electronics, CircuitLab stands out as a go-to resource. You can get started [here](https://www.circuitlab.com/) and begin building your next project today!
headline: Online circuit simulator and electronic schematic editor.
name: CircuitLab

description: Etleap is an ETL solution for creating perfect data pipelines from day one. Unlike other enterprise solutions, Etleap doesn’t require extensive engineering work to set up, maintain, and scale. It automates most ETL setup and maintenance work, and simplifies the rest into 10-minute tasks that analysts can own.
generated_description:
**Etleap: Simplifying ETL for the Modern Data Stack**

**Overview**

Etleap is a cutting-edge ETL solution based in San Francisco, designed to create seamless data pipelines without the headache of traditional setups. Launched in Y Combinator Batch W13, Etleap stands out by automating significant parts of ETL configuration and maintenance, allowing analysts to manage their data workflows with just a few clicks. With a lean team of 11 committed professionals, Etleap has built an efficient platform that helps businesses quickly ingest and transform data.

**Mission and Product**

The mission of Etleap is straightforward: to create "perfect data pipelines". They accomplish this by offering robust tools that allow users to effortlessly pull data from a variety of sources—be it databases, applications, APIs, or flat files. What’s truly innovative is how Etleap simplifies the entire ETL process, enabling users to complete tasks in as little as 10 minutes. 

**Features and Benefits**

1. **Comprehensive Ingestion**: Users can ingest data from 100% of their sources, making the data pipeline highly versatile.
2. **Powerful Transformation Tools**: Leverage tools like dbt Core and SQL for effective data modeling and transformation.
3. **End-to-End Integration**: Manage and monitor data flows seamlessly from ingestion to transformation.
4. **Customizable Pipelines**: Easily adapt pipelines to suit specific business needs, ensuring that they just work.
5. **Exceptional Support**: Etleap prides itself on providing direct access to ETL-savvy engineers and 24/7 support through platforms like Slack and Teams.

**Pricing Model**

Etleap operates on a consumption-based pricing strategy, offering predictability and scalability. Unlike competitors that charge based on data volume, Etleap charges based on the number of pipelines. This approach not only controls costs as data grows but also allows businesses to scale their ETL operations without unexpected expenses.

**Client Testimonials**

Etleap has garnered positive feedback from notable clients including Moderna, Morningstar, and eMoney. Clients often highlight the rapid implementation times and significant cost savings—one client noted a 50% reduction in ETL costs after switching to Etleap.

**Partnerships and Integrations**

Etleap integrates smoothly with top-tier platforms like AWS, Snowflake, and Databricks, ensuring users can leverage existing tools while benefiting from enhanced ETL capabilities.

**Why Choose Etleap?**

In a landscape where data is crucial for decision-making, Etleap positions itself as a vital partner for organizations looking to harness their data efficiently. With unparalleled ease of use, rapid scaling capabilities, and expert support, it’s a compelling choice for businesses ready to elevate their data strategy. 

For more information, or to see it in action, you can visit their website at [Etleap.com](https://etleap.com) or book a demo to get started right away!
headline: Etleap is an ETL solution for creating perfect data pipelines.
name: Etleap

description:
Today's funders are so conservative they only fund the most obvious ideas. At Experiment, we fund the ideas that they won't fund; the ideas that matter.

Since founding, over 47,000 citizens have pledged $9 million dollars supporting 900 scientific projects on the platform. 46% of all projects on Experiment are successfully funded. When the projects are finished, the scientists share the scientific results with their backers as lab notes and peer-reviewed publications.

Scientists from Stanford, Harvard, and Yale have chosen to use Experiment instead of writing grants. Bill Gates recognized Experiment by saying "this solution helps close the gap for potentially-promising but unfunded projects."
generated_description:
Experiment is a pioneering crowdfunding platform designed specifically for the scientific community. Founded in 2012 and part of Y Combinator's Winter 2013 batch, the company set out with a mission to support innovative scientific projects that traditional funders often overlook. The approach is straightforward: while today’s conventional funders prefer safe, obvious ideas, Experiment champions the bold, unorthodox endeavors that can lead to significant breakthroughs.

Since its inception, Experiment has gained impressive traction. Over 47,000 individuals have come together to pledge around $9 million to support approximately 900 diverse scientific projects. Notably, 46% of these projects succeed in reaching their funding goals. What’s refreshing is that once these projects conclude, the scientists share their findings with backers in the form of detailed lab notes and peer-reviewed publications—truly making the supporters part of the scientific journey.

The platform is chosen by researchers from prestigious institutions like Stanford, Harvard, and Yale as a viable alternative to traditional grant writing, which can be cumbersome and competitive. Bill Gates has acknowledged Experiment's impact on bridging the funding gap for promising, yet unfunded, projects.

Headquartered in Honolulu, Hawaii, with a small team of just one employee, the company operates in the crowdfunding marketplace. They provide an open platform where civic-minded individuals can engage with science and directly contribute to research initiatives. This not only fuels innovation but also encourages broader participation in scientific discovery, opening the door for future generations of scientists.

Experiment is all about making science accessible and exciting. The website is user-friendly, allowing visitors to discover different projects, start new ones, or just learn how it all works. For anyone interested in supporting science or participating in funding research, Experiment is the go-to platform.

For further information, you can check out their [website](http://experiment.com).
headline: crowdfunding platform for science
name: Experiment

description: Fivetran automates data movement out of, into and across cloud data platforms. With 99.9% uptime and self-healing pipelines, Fivetran enables hundreds of leading brands across the globe, including Autodesk, Conagra Brands, JetBlue, Lionsgate, Morgan Stanley, and Ziff Davis, to accelerate data-driven decisions and drive business growth. Fivetran is headquartered in Oakland, California, with offices around the world.
generated_description:
**Company Overview: Fivetran**

Founded in 2012 and based in Oakland, California, Fivetran has quickly established itself as a leader in the automated data movement space. Its mission? To streamline data handling for organizations, enabling them to prioritize high-impact projects instead of getting bogged down by routine data engineering tasks. Fivetran offers a platform that automates the Extract, Load, Transform (ELT) process, ensuring that data flows seamlessly into and across cloud data platforms. 

With a team of around 1,200 employees and as a proud member of Y Combinator’s Batch W13, Fivetran supports hundreds of global brands like Autodesk, JetBlue, and Morgan Stanley, achieving an impressive 99.9% uptime with self-healing pipelines. Their extensive automated connectors—over 650 in number—ensure that data can be effortlessly pulled from a variety of sources, including SaaS applications, databases, and more, to data warehouses and lakes, making for a comprehensive data ecosystem.

**Value Proposition**

Fivetran simplifies data movement, allowing companies to make quicker, data-driven decisions without getting tangled in manual processes. Their self-service model not only enhances data accessibility but also boosts organizational efficiency—leading to substantial ROI, with some customers reporting over 400% growth within three years.

**Key Features & Solutions**

1. **Automated Data Movement**: Their connectors facilitate efficient data integration without coding, providing businesses with real-time analytics and reducing overhead.
   
2. **Security & Compliance**: Fivetran adheres to stringent security measures, including SOC 1 & 2 certification, GDPR compliance, and HIPAA BAA, ensuring that sensitive data remains protected.
   
3. **Flexible Deployment**: Companies can deploy Fivetran solutions in cloud, hybrid, or on-premise environments, accommodating various business needs and security protocols.

**Target Audience & Use Cases**

Fivetran primarily serves B2B clients across various industries looking to leverage data analytics for marketing, finance, operations, and more. Their platform is specifically beneficial for organizations undergoing digital transformation, those leveraging AI/ML capabilities, or businesses interested in scaling data infrastructure efficiently.

**Conclusion**

Fivetran is not just about moving data; it’s about enabling businesses to innovate and grow through smarter data practices. As organizations continue to realize the importance of data in driving decisions, Fivetran’s focus on automation and seamless integrations positions it as a vital player in the analytics landscape. 

For more information, check out their [website](http://fivetran.com).

**Mission and Vision**: InfluxData's mission is clear: it aims to simplify the process of building and operating time series applications. Their tools allow developers to collect, analyze, and act on data—from sensors, devices, or even human inputs—faster and more efficiently than ever before.

**Key Offerings**: InfluxData provides a range of products tailored for flexibility and control:
- **InfluxDB Cloud**: Fully managed services, both in Serverless and Dedicated forms, allowing users to scale effortlessly in the cloud.
- **Self-Managed Solutions**: For organizations that desire complete control, InfluxData offers Clustered versions of InfluxDB that can be implemented on-premises or in hybrid environments.

**Use Cases**: The applications of InfluxData’s technology are broad and impactful, including:
- Real-time analytics for infrastructure and application monitoring
- Network and device telemetry for IoT systems
- Predictive maintenance through advanced analytics
- Machine Learning and AI project support

**Clientele**: With a customer base that includes tech giants like Autodesk, Cisco, and eBay, InfluxData has proven its reliability and efficacy in the marketplace, translating complex data into actionable insights across numerous industries.

**Team and Culture**: Backed by a robust team of around 210 employees and advice from prominent partners like Y Combinator (where they were part of Batch W13), InfluxData represents a solid blend of innovative technology and skilled talent.

**Marketplace Position**: As of 2023, InfluxData stands as a leader in the time series database arena, boasting over a billion downloads of InfluxDB and a thriving open-source ecosystem with over 1 million active instances.

To learn more and explore how InfluxData can empower your time series applications, check out their website at [InfluxData](https://www.influxdata.com). If you’re looking to dive into the world of time series analytics, they have the tools and resources to get you started swiftly and effectively.

description:
Lawdingo gets people in touch with a lawyer very quickly.

Lawdingo gives people seeking legal services direct access to independent lawyers who can help them. Such attorneys usually have more flexible hours, lower rates, and greater interest in customer service than to their larger firm counterparts. The problem is that there is so many such lawyers; how is someone supposed to figure out who is right for them, and who has some time to take on their case? Fair question. Coincidentally, we started Lawdingo to answer just that. 

If you're looking for a lawyer, we encourage you to try finding an easier way to get one to work for you. If you are a lawyer working in solo or small practice, we encourage you to find a more effective way to grow your law practice. 

We also encourage you not to take our word for it. Read what Solo Practice University, the ABA Journal, FindLaw, AboveTheLaw, TechCrunch, Lifehacker, and others say about us. This isn't some fly-by-the-night company. This is the future of the legal industry. We hope you'll get in touch. 

Lawdingo was started by Nikhil Nirmel (nikhil@lawdingo.com), an entrepreneur with a background at Yelp and Wharton Undergrad, and Dan Langevin , a ridiculously talented technologist who was formerly CTO of Lifebooker. Lawdingo has backing from Y Combinator and other investors.
generated_description:
**Overview of Lawdingo**

**Company Name:** Lawdingo  
**Location:** New York  
**Founded:** As part of Y Combinator Batch W13  
**Founders:** Nikhil Nirmel (with Yelp and Wharton background) and Dan Langevin (former CTO of Lifebooker)  
**Website:** [lawdingo.com](http://lawdingo.com)  

**Mission:** Lawdingo's primary mission is to connect people quickly and efficiently with independent lawyers. By doing so, they aim to simplify the often convoluted legal service landscape and provide effective virtual paralegal services to law firms.

**The Problem:** Navigating the sea of available lawyers can be overwhelming. Many of them have flexible schedules and lower rates compared to larger firms, but users often struggle to find the right fit for their specific legal needs. Lawdingo was created to solve this problem.

**What They Offer:** Lawdingo connects individuals seeking legal aid with independent lawyers who excel in customer service. Their innovative platform not only helps clients but also provides solo and small practices with better ways to scale and manage their practices.

**Key Features:**
1. **AI-Powered Client Interaction:** Lawdingo uses advanced AI technology to manage inbound and outbound calls, ensuring that no client query goes unattended at any hour.
2. **Tailored Solutions:** Their AI solutions can be customized to adapt to the specific processes of individual law firms.
3. **24/7 Availability:** Lawdingo’s services operate around-the-clock, ensuring that legal help is always accessible.
4. **Cost Efficiency:** Reducing the need for human receptionists, their system allows firms to save on staffing costs while still providing high-quality service.
5. **Lead Qualification:** The service pre-screens potential clients, ensuring lawyers spend time on the most promising cases.

**Community and Endorsements:** Lawdingo has received positive mentions from credible sources like Solo Practice University, ABA Journal, TechCrunch, and Above The Law, indicating its trusted reputation in the legal tech space. 

If you’re in need of legal assistance or looking to improve your law practice's efficiency, Lawdingo invites you to experience what they offer firsthand. They’re not just another startup; they represent a shift toward a more accessible and efficient legal industry. 

For those looking to dive deeper or start a collaboration, Lawdingo encourages potential users and lawyers to reach out and explore their services.
headline: Lawdingo provides virtual paralegal services to law firms.
name: Lawdingo

Checkout a Padlet timeline (https://padl.et/timeline), or a Padlet map (https://padl.et/map) to see what we're talking about. 

Over ten million people all over the world use Padlet. Most satisfyingly, for millions of kids, Padlet is their first experience of creating things on the Internet.

People say we are improving education. People say we are making them more creative. People say a lot of things.

description:
RADAR is a platform that combines RFID and computer vision to automate and augment retail store processes. Our technology offers unprecedented speed and location accuracy, which allows stores to:

1) Manage inventory efficiently, through automated inventory counts, improved in-store replenishment and instantaneous customer stock checks

2) Eliminate checkout lines altogether through our autonomous checkout tool.

3) Measure all customer-product interactions, giving physical stores the same insight into consumer behavior and product performance as online stores.

https://goradar.com
generated_description:
**Company Overview: RADAR**

**Mission:**  
RADAR is on a mission to transform the in-store retail experience through cutting-edge technology, specifically leveraging RFID (Radio-Frequency Identification) and computer vision. Their goal? To bring unparalleled efficiency and insight to retail operations.

**What They Do:**  
Founded as part of Y Combinator’s W13 batch and located in New York, RADAR integrates hardware and software to address longstanding challenges in inventory management and customer experience. They’ve developed a platform designed to:

1. **Automate Inventory Management**: Their system conducts rapid inventory counts, enhances restocking processes, and facilitates instant stock checks for customers.
   
2. **Eliminate Checkout Lines**: With their autonomous checkout feature, customers can simply grab items and walk out—charges happen automatically the moment they leave the store.

3. **Enhance Customer Insight**: By measuring all interactions between customers and products, RADAR provides physical stores with crucial analytics that were previously only available online.

**Technology Edge:**  
RADAR’s proprietary technology achieves impressive speed and accuracy in tracking products—every item is monitored in real time, allowing retailers to respond more quickly to stock demands and customer preferences. This innovation not only tackles traditional inventory woes but also positions retailers as viable fulfillment centers for e-commerce, which is increasingly vital in today’s market.

**The Team:**  
With 46 dedicated employees and a collective background that includes designing and launching satellites, manufacturing RFID readers, and implementing tech solutions in numerous stores, RADAR’s team combines deep industry knowledge with technical prowess.

**The Future of Retail:**  
RADAR is reimagining RFID for the retail sector—making it viable and effective, unlike earlier iterations that fell short of expectations. They believe that knowing what’s in a store, and exactly where it is, empowers retailers to operate smarter, fulfill orders more efficiently, and ultimately enhance the shopping experience for customers.

For more information, visit their website at [goradar.com](https://goradar.com). If you’re interested in getting on their radar—whether as a partner, customer, or team member—you can reach them directly. 

In a nutshell, RADAR isn't just improving retail processes; they’re redefining what’s possible in brick-and-mortar shopping. This could very well be the future of retail, so keep an eye on them.
headline: RADAR is building technology to completely transform the in-storeâ¦
name: RADAR

**Scuba: The Analytics Solution for the Impatient**

Founded in 2013 and part of Y Combinator's Batch W13, Scuba has established itself as a innovative force in the field of analytics. The company operates under the clear mission of providing "Analytics for impatient people," making it a go-to solution for rapid data analysis that answers pressing business questions around customer behavior and product usage.

Scuba’s flagship product, Interana, is a fast and scalable event-based analytics platform that enables users to dig deep into critical metrics—like growth, retention, and engagement—in a matter of seconds. Unlike traditional analytics tools that leave users grappling for insights for hours or days, Interana’s intuitive and interactive interface integrates seamlessly into everyday workflows, democratizing data access and enhancing decision-making.

Located in the heart of the tech world, Scuba boasts a team of 51 dedicated employees and has partnered with notable groups to further its reach. With its offerings tagged under ‘analytics’, ‘big data’, ‘data engineering’, and ‘data visualization’, Scuba ensures it meets diverse customer needs in a data-driven landscape.

### What Scuba Offers:

1. **Real-Time Insights**: Flows of data are analyzed in real-time, allowing businesses to react swiftly to changes and opportunities as they arise.
   
2. **Human in the Loop**: Scuba bridges the gap between autonomous AI agents and human reasoning, allowing businesses to decode customer interactions efficiently.

3. **Privacy Enhancements**: The platform includes built-in privacy technology to meet global regulations, maintaining customer trust while delivering actionable insights.

4. **Automation and Integration**: Scuba can deliver signals directly to tools like Slack or Tableau without necessitating intricate data engineering, making daily operations smoother and more efficient.

### A Glance at Success:

Clients, like the Bleacher Report, have heralded Scuba for its transformative impact on user engagement and churn rates. With testimonials highlighting unparalleled visibility into user interactions, it's clear that Scuba doesn’t just facilitate analytics; it empowers businesses to cultivate meaningful relationships with their customers.

**Ready to dive into analytics?** Visit [Scuba's website](https://www.scuba.io) to learn more or schedule a demo today. With Scuba, impatience becomes a competitive advantage.
headline: Analytics for impatient people.
name: Scuba

description:
SimplyInsured was founded with one mission: to eliminate fear from health insurance. By changing the way small business owners purchase health insurance with our 100% online platform, we’re transforming a $20 billion dollar industry and delighting thousands of customers. 

Our unique values-based culture (and extremely talented team) is our core competitive advantage, and each person on our team makes a direct, immediate impact on our business. 

We value transparency, feedback, bias to action, growth, and an obligation to dissent. Every opinion is respected, we hold each other to extremely high standards, we’re driven by the diversity in our backgrounds, and unified by 100% alignment on our mission. 

What’s best for the customer is the heart of everything we do, and our customer stories prove it: by changing health insurance we’re literally saving lives. 

Based in San Francisco, SimplyInsured was founded in 2012 and is back by Bessemer Venture Partners, Polaris Ventures, and Y-Combinator. If you’re up for the challenge of improving health insurance for millions of Americans, we’re just getting started, and we’re growing!

The company prides itself on respecting diverse opinions and encourages dissenting voices to ensure they are always improving.

SimplyInsured offers a unique value proposition: free, unbiased recommendations tailored to each business's needs, and everything can be completed online. This means busy owners can secure health coverage with just a few clicks, saving time and avoiding headaches along the way.

Support is another strong pillar for SimplyInsured. Their dedicated customer support team works for the customers, not the insurance carriers. This approach has proven effective, with testimonials highlighting their responsiveness and effectiveness in resolving issues—sometimes with life-saving outcomes for their customers.

If you're a small business owner looking to navigate the often daunting waters of health insurance, SimplyInsured offers a way to do it without losing your mind or your wallet. To explore their offerings or to get an instant quote, visit [SimplyInsured.com](http://simplyinsured.com). They are just getting started, and it’s clear they have ambitious plans for the future.

#### Current Promotions

#### Community and Trust

With an easy-to-navigate platform, robust features, and a focus on mobile-first design, it empowers creators from all walks of life to make their visions a reality.

Watsi is an innovative non-profit organization that launched in 2011 and is recognized as the first global crowdfunding platform specifically for medical care. Their mission is simple yet powerful: to leverage technology to provide universal healthcare funding through direct costs for surgeries and primary care.

The way Watsi works is straightforward: anyone can fund a patient’s healthcare needs, with 100% of donations going directly to the surgeries. This approach not only helps patients get the care they need but also allows donors to see the real impact of their contributions. You can choose to make a one-time donation, start a monthly subscription to consistently support new patients, or even launch your own fundraising campaign.

One striking aspect of Watsi is the transparency it offers; donors receive updates after the treatments, meaning that you can witness firsthand the difference your support makes in someone's life. Patients like Valentine from Kenya, who suffered a motorcycle accident and needs surgery to repair her leg, rely on this platform. Her story is one of many; Watsi has successfully funded over 30,000 surgeries through their community of more than 31,000 donors.

By emphasizing grassroots funding, Watsi is redefining how we think about healthcare access in underserved regions worldwide. They believe that everyone, regardless of background or location, deserves access to medical care. If you want to be part of this change, you can visit them at [Watsi.org](https://watsi.org).

In summary, Watsi is not just a crowdfunding site; it’s a lifeline for many people facing medical crises. Their commitment to healthcare equity and donor transparency makes them a standout in the crowded non-profit space. Want to help? Check out their site, meet a patient, and consider making a donation. Your small act can lead to profound change.

description:
We help everyone invest in startups that they care about.

We believe that when all Americans can invest in innovation, the world will be a better place. And soon, our dream will become a reality. Thanks to the JOBS Act, everyone — not just the wealthy — can invest as little as $100 in the startups they care about. Not only does this open up the pool of investors, and increase the amount of great ideas that get funded, but it allows startups to grow an army of passionate investors who truly want to see them succeed. Second tier VC’s will become obsolete as startups tap their lead users and customers for quick early investments.
founders: [{'name': 'Nick Tommarello, Founder/CEO', 'description': 'CEO, Wefunder', 'linkedin': 'https://www.linkedin.com/in/nicktommarello/'}, {'name': 'Greg Belote, Founder/CTO', 'description': None, 'linkedin': 'https://www.linkedin.com/in/gregbelote/'}]
generated_description:
**Wefunder: Revolutionizing Startup Investment**

Founded in 2011 and hailing from the Y Combinator W13 batch, Wefunder is on a mission to democratize access to startup investments. Think of them as the Robinhood for pre-IPO startups: their goal is to allow everyone, regardless of their financial status, to invest in innovative companies. 

Their philosophy? When everyday Americans can invest in the startups they care about, it doesn't just make those companies richer; it enhances the entire ecosystem of innovation. With the rollout of the JOBS Act, which allows investments as small as $100, Wefunder is set to change the game. This initiative opens the floodgates for a diverse range of investors, potentially replacing traditional venture capitalists as startups can now tap their users and customers directly for early funding.

Based in San Francisco and consisting of a team of 35 dedicated employees, Wefunder is positioned at the intersection of fintech and community-driven investment. They believe in the power of passionate investors—they're not just funding entities; they’re advocates for the startups they back. 

In a world where seed funding can often feel like a closed loop dominated by the wealthy, Wefunder is striving to level the playing field. By enabling collective financial support from a larger pool of investors, they're enabling more great ideas to blossom and, ultimately, changing the way we think about startup financing.

For more information, you can visit their website at [wefunder.com](http://wefunder.com).
headline: We're Robinhood for pre-IPO startups. Everyone can invest $100.
name: Wefunder
